thread.title: Utah Medicaid expansion gets possible deathblow
thread.title_full: Utah Medicaid expansion gets possible deathblow | Washington Examiner

author: Robert King
title: Utah Medicaid expansion gets possible deathblow
text:
Utah Republicans rejected a proposal from state leaders to expand Medicaid under Obamacare, immediately sparking concerns about whether the expansion would be approved.
The Salt Lake Tribune reported late Tuesday that a proposed expansion received only seven votes out of 63 Republican state House members during a closed-door meeting.
The reason was concerns about exploding costs and opposition from medical providers who may have had to pay for part of the program, the paper said.
Related Story: http://www.washingtonexaminer.com/article/2574118/ The Tribune reported that Republican Gov. Gary Herbert wanted to call a special legislative session this month to pass the expansion, but that now appears in doubt.
More from the Washington Examiner Rubio: Dems 'more liberal today' than any time since Dukakis During a New Hampshire town hall meeting, the senator admitted he watched 'snippets' of the Dem debate.
By Al Weaver â€¢ 10/14/15 2:44 PM So far 30 states have expanded Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act. That includes several red states that want waivers from the Obama administration to make changes for Medicaid eligibility under the expansion.
For instance, Montana agreed to expand the law earlier this year. It still needs a waiver from the federal government because it changes the program to have some recipients pay monthly premiums.
